raw_articles.output:
{
    "feature_name": "Salary Proration",
    "documentation_knowledge_pack": {
        "job_to_be_done": "Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement",
        "primary_user_persona": "Super admin",
        "key_actions_steps": [
            "Go to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation",
            "Select calculation bases (custom days, calendar days, or working days)", 
            "Save changes",
            "Reject and resave prorated salary transactions if needed"
        ],
        "rules_limitations": [
            "Changes will affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table",
            "When payroll month is open, super admin must reject existing prorated salary transactions before saving new proration settings"
        ],
        "data_inputs_required": [
            "Calculation basis selection: custom days, calendar days, or working days"
        ],
        "outputs_results": [
            "Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method"
        ],
        "edge_cases": [
            "When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, super admin must manually reject and resave transactions"
        ],
        "feature_interactions": [
            "Interacts with Payroll system",
            "Interacts with Daily Wage Calculator (DWC)", 
            "Affects active payroll table transactions"
        ]
    },
    "claims_to_validate": [
        "Super admin can select between custom days, calendar days, and working days for salary proration",
        "Changing proration settings affects all active (unpaid) payroll amounts",
        "Open payroll months require manual transaction rejection before saving new proration settings",
        "Salary proration impacts first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations",
        "Daily Wage Calculator enables proportional salary adjustments"
    ]
}
